text.title: Know Where North Is
text.head: Know Where North Is
text.p: Regardless of if your compass is broken, you don't have a compass, you lost it, or where you are, if you are lost it is important to know where north is. If you don't you could end up in the desert when you want to be closer to the arctic or vice versa.
text.head: Steps
Sunrise and Sunset

list.item:
Watch the sun
The sun always rises and sets from east to west. If you watch the sun and have west to your left and east to your right you are facing north.
Note: This only works if it isn't summer or winter if you are at the arctic or antarctic circle and if you aren't at the equator.

text.head: Moonrise and Moonset

list.item:
Watch the moon
On some clear nights you can't see the stars but you can see the moon. It rises and sets in the same direction as the sun.
Note: This only works if it isn't summer or winter if you are at the arctic or antarctic circle and if you aren't at the equator.

text.head: Find the north star

list.item:
Watch the stars
On a starry night you might be able to see the north star. Contrary to popular belief it isn't the brightest star(Alpha centauri is the brightest). It is the only star that doesn't appear to move in the night sky.
Note: This only works if you are in the northern hemisphere and not at the true north pole. At the true north pole, every direction is south.

text.head: Find the southern cross

list.item:
Watch the stars
If you are in the southern hemisphere you can't see the north star. You can however see the southern cross. The stars at the edges of the cross are like a compass.
Note: This only works if you are not at the true south pole. There, every direction is north.

text.head: Arctic and Antarctic summer

list.item:
Watch the sun
The sun will be at the horizon, still moving east to west. However during the arctic and antarctic summers there is no night.

text.head: Arctic and Antarctic winter

list.item:
Watch the stars
The moon won't be as accurate of a guide during the polar night. The polar night is when it is completely dark for 24 hours in the arctic or antarctic. The stars can still help you at this time.

text.head: WCS: Completely Cloudy Polar Night

list.item:
Survive in the arctic or antarctic
If it is completely cloudy and it is the polar night, the only thing you can do is survive in the arctic or antarctic until you can see the stars again.

text.head: Find Orion

list.item:
If you are at the equator Orion will help you find north
Note: This works for the northern and southern hemispheres also but only during certain times of the year.

text.head: Tips

list.item: Always wear 4 layers in the arctic and more in the antarctic.

text.head: Warnings

list.item: Antarctic winds can be as strong as 200 mph(That is about as strong as a category 5 hurricane or an F3 tornado). That is strong enough to blow you across Antarctica into the cold ocean. Water is the worst thing to be in when it is very cold.
